intro: Macaranga hispida var. papuana, commonly known as the Papuan nettle, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its opposite leaves and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. The flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences.
